definitions.definition: the study of how a society organizes its money, trade and industry

examples.text: He studied politics and economics at Yale.

definitions.definition: the way in which money influences, or is organized within, an area of business or society

examples.text: The economics of the project are very encouraging.
The economics of maintaining a safe environment are not just the concern of the government.

wordOrigin: late 16th cent. (denoting the science of household management): from economic + the plural suffix -s, originally on the pattern of Greek ta oikonomika (plural), the name of a treatise by Aristotle. Current senses date from the late 18th cent.
